DOC.brief_summary: Subjects with Obstructive Sleep Apnea (OSA) are at increased risk of developing cardiometabolic complications, and effective long-term nCPAP treatment significantly reduces the risk of cardiovascular morbidity and mortality.
DOC.brief_title: Long Term Cardiovascular Complications in Men With Obstructive Sleep Apnea
DOC.detailed_description: 1. Primary outcome: Incidence of cardiometabolic diseases in subjects with OSA over 9 years. 2. Secondary outcomes: Effects of CPAP treatment on cardiometabolic conditions
DOC.criteria: From previous cohort for reassessment. Unstable medical conditions
